name: Hostname Control Utility
description: Hostnamectl is a utility for viewing and changing the hostname and related settings on a system. It is part of the systemd suite, which is a system and service manager for Linux operating systems. Hostnamectl allows users to view the current hostname, set a new hostname, and manage the static, pretty, and transient hostnames. The utility can also display the current deployment environment and other related settings like the icon name and chassis type.
